DataElement.preferredName: PI-RADS Diffusion Weighted Imaging Assessed Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score to represent a structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS) with a diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy._A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/9/14 created for C3D (Dr. Pinto) PI-RADS Protocol 14C0112. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy._A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Focal area/mass of hyper SI on the high b-value images (>=b800) with reduced ADC

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Focal area/mass of hyper SI on the high b-value images (>=b800) with reduced ADC
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Focal area/mass of hyper SI on the high b-value images (>=b800) with reduced ADC.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Focal area(s) of reduced ADC but iso-intense SI on high b-value images (>=b800)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Focal area(s) of reduced ADC but iso-intense SI on high b-value images (>=b800)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Focal area(s) of reduced ADC but iso-intense SI on high b-value images (>=b800).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate appearances not in categories a/b or d/e.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate appearances not in categories a/b or d/e.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intermediate appearances not in categories a/b or d/e.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Diffuse, hyper SI on >=b800 image with low ADC; no focal features, however, linear, triangular or geographical features are allowed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diffuse, hyper SI on >=b800 image with low ADC; no focal features, however, linear, triangular or geographical features are allowed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diffuse, hyper SI on >=b800 image with low ADC; no focal features, however, linear, triangular or geographical features are allowed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No reduction in ADC compared with normal glandular tissue. No increase in SI on any high b-value image (>=b800)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No reduction in ADC compared with normal glandular tissue. No increase in SI on any high b-value image (>=b800)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No reduction in ADC compared with normal glandular tissue. No increase in SI on any high b-value image (>=b800).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy.:A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
